chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan M Sauve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Susan M Sauve is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Susan M Sauve was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

supervisions.notes: $300.00 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
